com.dp16.dynamicrunninginghent.StatTracker

Class StatTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dp16.dynamicrunninginghent.StatTracker.StatTracker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, EventPublisher

    public class StatTracker
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventListener, EventPublisher
    This class collects statistics while running and stores them in a RunningStatistics object.

    Messages Produced: Constants.EventTypes.STORE_RUNNINGSTATISTICS

    Messages Consumed: Constants.EventTypes.SPEED, Constants.EventTypes.LOCATION, Constants.EventTypes.DISTANCE

    Created by hendrikdepauw on 07/03/2017.

    • Method Detail

      • startStatTracker

        public void startStatTracker()

      • stopStatTracker

        public void stopStatTracker()
        Stops the statTracker and adds total runDuration to the runningStatistics. Beware, this method does not store the runningstatistics. To do this you have to call saveRunningStatistics(). I think it is save to call this method more than once.

      • resumeStatTracker

        public void resumeStatTracker()

      • pauseStatTracker

        public void pauseStatTracker()

      • saveRunningStatistics

        public void saveRunningStatistics()
        This method does three things: 1. Save the runningStatistics locally 2. Save the runningStatistics on the server 3. Add the runningStatistics to the AggregatedRunningStatistics

      • getRunningStatistics

        public RunningStatistics getRunningStatistics()

      • addRating

        public void addRating(double rating)
        Add a rating to the runningstatistics. Can only do so if they are not written to a file yet. Maybe throw an exception if this is the case?
        Parameters:
        rating - rating to be added.

      • handleEvent

        public void handleEvent(java.lang.String eventType,
                        java.lang.Object message)
        Called when an event enters the StatTracker. Passes work to the worker thread.
        Specified by:
        handleEvent in interface EventListener
        Parameters:
        eventType -
        message -
